vocabularyDefinition.en: Observations whose results are somehow related.

applicationProfileDefinition.en: Observations whose results are somehow related.

applicationProfileUsageNote.en: It is about coherence that is important to understand the result of individual observations, e.g. biotic relationships (animal A is predator and is present because animal B is prey). Such relationships require to be explicitly described (as opposed to relationships such as the coincidence of results of Observations in space or time that may remain implicit). Also useful for relationships where the output of Observation A is the input for Observation B.
